Node.definition: literally to pluck up (the tent pegs); hence: = action by which a relatively large company of humans, together with their possessions, departs from a place where they had set up a temporary residence
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

Node.gloss: to set up (a tent)|to erect (a tent)|to encamp
Node.definition: = action by which an individual or group of people settles in a certain location for a limited period of time and often for a specific purpose
= a nation and its territory; ◄ situated E. of Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח) regarded as founded by a son of Lot (לֹוט)
= river; ◄ flowing from Mount Hermon (חֶרְמֹון) in a southerly direction through the Sea of Galilee (כִּנֶּרֶת) into the Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח)
= town; ◄ located northwest of the Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח) territory of Benjamin (בִּנְיָמִן) ► first town conquered by Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) after they entered Canaan (כְּנַעַן)

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= man; ◄ son of Zippor (צִפֹּור) ► king of Moab (מֹואָב) tried to curse and destroy the Israelites on their way to Canaan (כְּנַעַן)
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ► father of Balak (בָּלָק) king of Moab (מֹואָב)

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= member of ethnic group; ◄ original inhabitants of Canaan (כְּנַעַן)
= state in which humans experience a strong fear of other humans, deities, or animals
= a nation and its territory; ◄ situated E. of Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח) regarded as founded by a son of Lot (לֹוט)
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= process by which human experience an emotion of fear ◄ regarding someone who is more powerful or numerous
= a nation and its territory; ◄ situated E. of Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח) regarded as founded by a son of Lot (לֹוט)
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= a nation and its territory; ◄ situated E. of Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח) regarded as founded by a son of Lot (לֹוט)

= a council or a group of older men who act with authority on behalf of or over their people; some represent an entire nation, others manage the affairs at the town level; some provide their leader with counsel; involved in both judicial and military decisions, and participating in cultic ceremonies; ≈ expected to be wise and considered worthy of deference and respect
= man; ◄ son of Midian (מִדְיָן) son of Keturah (קְטוּרָה) wife of Abraham (אַבְרָהָם) ► regarded as the founder of a nation with the same name
= a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place
literally: to lick up; hence: = a process by which humans completely use up all vegetation in a certain area

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= action by which animals ingest food with the help of their tongue

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= green leaves ◄ of a plant or tree; ► eaten by both animals and humans; ≈ associated with weakness and mortality

= a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.
= man; ◄ son of Zippor (צִפֹּור) ► king of Moab (מֹואָב) tried to curse and destroy the Israelites on their way to Canaan (כְּנַעַן)
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ► father of Balak (בָּלָק) king of Moab (מֹואָב)
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= a nation and its territory; ◄ situated E. of Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח) regarded as founded by a son of Lot (לֹוט)
= a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
= causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task
= a human or supernatural being who carries a message on behalf of someone else
= man; ◄ son of Beor (בְּעֹור) from Pethor (פְּתֹור) ► a non Israelite prophet or fortune teller; ≈ the name became a symbol for attempts to deviate Israel from its divinely chosen path
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ► father of Balaam (בִּלְעָם)
= town; ◄ north of Mesopotamia; ► home of Balaam (בִּלְעָם)
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= large body of flowing water ◄ located in Mesopotamia

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
literally: to cry out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities let (other) humans know that they are to come, either by approaching them directly or sending a message

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to go out|to come out|to go away|to leave|to depart
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name
literally: to cover; hence: = state in which objects are present in a very great quantity

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: the eye (of an object); hence: = the part of an object that can be seen with the eye

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
= relational linking an event to a location right in front of another location
= a marker indicating that an important statement is following and demanding the attention of the listener
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination

= to consign someone or something to death, damage, or destruction, usually by invoking the name of a deity if the agent is human; ◄ this is done as punishment, out of contempt, anger, or hostility, or because one was hired to do so

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= state in which humans or animals are numerous and therefore potentially powerful
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

Node.gloss: perhaps|maybe|what if|suppose ...|in the unlikely event that ...
Node.definition: = marker indicating that the information that follows is possibly true but that there is no complete certainty

mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible
= causative action by which people are expelled from their dwelling place

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= action by which humans communicate with the spirit world using a variety of means such as inspecting the liver of animals, shaking arrows, consulting teraphim, or casting lots; ≈ usually regarded as an evil practice that is to be condemned; responsibility of a prophet or king

Node.gloss: to hold, carry, have (in one's luggage)
Node.definition: literally: in (one's) hand; hence: = state of carrying an object physically in one's hand or as part of one's luggage

Node.gloss: to respond|to bring back word|to report

= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes

= a certain quantity that fill a certain container

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins
= metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity

mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= an action by which humans and deities utter words, ◄ as coming from their mouths
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= state in which an event is considered trivial and insignificant
= particle linking two entities by which Y is added to X as an additional option
= state in which an event has a high intensity
= a marker indicating that an important statement is following and demanding the attention of the listener
= state in which humans remain in a place that is not their home for a relatively short time

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= referent to a group of male (and female) participants that are addressed if a discourse
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= process by which an action is repeated or continued
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= man; ◄ son of Beor (בְּעֹור) from Pethor (פְּתֹור) ► a non Israelite prophet or fortune teller; ≈ the name became a symbol for attempts to deviate Israel from its divinely chosen path
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
literally: to cry out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities let (other) humans know that they are to come, either by approaching them directly or sending a message
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= particle marking a constituent as representing a limited number of entities

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= man; ◄ son of Beor (בְּעֹור) from Pethor (פְּתֹור) ► a non Israelite prophet or fortune teller; ≈ the name became a symbol for attempts to deviate Israel from its divinely chosen path
= first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil
= causative action by which humans put a piece of cloth on the back of an animal; ► in order to be able to ride on it

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= large, strong, female donkey (חֲמֹור) ► used for riding
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere
= a nation and its territory; ◄ situated E. of Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח) regarded as founded by a son of Lot (לֹוט)
= process by which the anger (אַף) of humans and deities is aroused ◄ like a fire that is kindled
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination

= action by which humans or deities take position in a certain place for a specific purpose

= an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly

= offensive weapon consisting of long blade for cutting or thrusting or both, and hilt with hand guard; ◄ made out of iron; ► used in warfare; ≈ symbol of aggression and punishment

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals
= action by which humans leave the main road to interrupt their journey or take a side road

= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination

= a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.
= man; ◄ son of Beor (בְּעֹור) from Pethor (פְּתֹור) ► a non Israelite prophet or fortune teller; ≈ the name became a symbol for attempts to deviate Israel from its divinely chosen path

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= a continuous vertical structure, usually made of natural stones, that encloses or divides an area of land; ≈ associated with security; in some cases used figuratively to denote integrity, which can be negatively affected by sin

= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= man; ◄ son of Beor (בְּעֹור) from Pethor (פְּתֹור) ► a non Israelite prophet or fortune teller; ≈ the name became a symbol for attempts to deviate Israel from its divinely chosen path

= to prostrate oneself ► in order to pay homage to a superior
= action by which humans lay themselves down on the ground in front of another human or a deity, ► as an act of submission or respect

= the entire front side of a person's head, with special focus on the forehead, which is the part that touches the ground when a person does obeisance, and the part that is covered with sweat during hard work

= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere
= man; ◄ son of Zippor (צִפֹּור) ► king of Moab (מֹואָב) tried to curse and destroy the Israelites on their way to Canaan (כְּנַעַן)
= man; ◄ son of Zippor (צִפֹּור) ► king of Moab (מֹואָב) tried to curse and destroy the Israelites on their way to Canaan (כְּנַעַן)
= man; ◄ son of Beor (בְּעֹור) from Pethor (פְּתֹור) ► a non Israelite prophet or fortune teller; ≈ the name became a symbol for attempts to deviate Israel from its divinely chosen path

Node.gloss: to go out|to come out|to go away|to leave|to depart
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position
= action by which humans purposefully move in the direction of (another) human, deity, or object to engage with them

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= a nation and its territory; ◄ situated E. of Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח) regarded as founded by a son of Lot (לֹוט)
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= a set of limits that separates part of a whole from other parts, with focus either on the limits itself or on the area or object surrounded by it
= river; ◄ east of the Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) ► constitutes border between Moab (מֹואָב) and Ammon (עַמֹּון)
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= a set of limits that separates part of a whole from other parts, with focus either on the limits itself or on the area or object surrounded by it

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= man; ◄ son of Zippor (צִפֹּור) ► king of Moab (מֹואָב) tried to curse and destroy the Israelites on their way to Canaan (כְּנַעַן)
= man; ◄ son of Beor (בְּעֹור) from Pethor (פְּתֹור) ► a non Israelite prophet or fortune teller; ≈ the name became a symbol for attempts to deviate Israel from its divinely chosen path
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= causative action by which humans or deities send one or more people though the people sent are not mentioned explicitly to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task
= causative action by which humans or deities send one or more people though the people sent are not mentioned explicitly to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task
literally: to cry out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities let (other) humans know that they are to come, either by approaching them directly or sending a message
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= marker challenging the truth of a statement

mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible
= action by which humans, deities, or animals treat other humans, deities, times, or objects with honor and respect

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= man; ◄ son of Beor (בְּעֹור) from Pethor (פְּתֹור) ► a non Israelite prophet or fortune teller; ≈ the name became a symbol for attempts to deviate Israel from its divinely chosen path
= man; ◄ son of Zippor (צִפֹּור) ► king of Moab (מֹואָב) tried to curse and destroy the Israelites on their way to Canaan (כְּנַעַן)
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible

mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= a reference to any event
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to put in (someone's) mouth > to give (to someone) to speak
Node.definition: literally: to put in (someone's) mouth; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities give (other) humans the assignment to pass on a specific message to others
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= man; ◄ son of Beor (בְּעֹור) from Pethor (פְּתֹור) ► a non Israelite prophet or fortune teller; ≈ the name became a symbol for attempts to deviate Israel from its divinely chosen path
= man; ◄ son of Zippor (צִפֹּור) ► king of Moab (מֹואָב) tried to curse and destroy the Israelites on their way to Canaan (כְּנַעַן)
= town; ◄ in Moab (מֹואָב)

= the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense
= man; ◄ son of Zippor (צִפֹּור) ► king of Moab (מֹואָב) tried to curse and destroy the Israelites on their way to Canaan (כְּנַעַן)

= large ruminant animals with horns and cloven hoofs, ► chiefly domesticated for meat or milk, as beasts of burden, or for pulling a cart or a plow; it is a clean animal and can be eaten and sacrificed; ≈ regarded as a sign of wealth

= group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd
= causative action by which humans or deities send an object to (other) humans, usually through the mediation of a messenger
= man; ◄ son of Beor (בְּעֹור) from Pethor (פְּתֹור) ► a non Israelite prophet or fortune teller; ≈ the name became a symbol for attempts to deviate Israel from its divinely chosen path
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil
= man; ◄ son of Zippor (צִפֹּור) ► king of Moab (מֹואָב) tried to curse and destroy the Israelites on their way to Canaan (כְּנַעַן)

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= man; ◄ son of Beor (בְּעֹור) from Pethor (פְּתֹור) ► a non Israelite prophet or fortune teller; ≈ the name became a symbol for attempts to deviate Israel from its divinely chosen path
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or objects to go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot or carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle
= location; ◄ in Moab (מֹואָב) ► from where Balaam (בִּלְעָם) was to curse the Israelites (יִשְׂרָאֵל)

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
